vialab.SMT

Class TouchClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • vialab.SMT.TouchClient

  • public class TouchClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The TUIO/Touch Processing client. University of Ontario Institute of Technology. Summer Research Assistant with Dr. Christopher Collins (Summer 2011) collaborating with Dr. Mark Hancock.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Erik Paluka, Zach Cook

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String defaultRenderer
      The renderer to use as a default for zones, can be P3D, P2D, OPENGL, etc, upon TouchClient initialization this is set to the same as the PApplet's renderer
      protected vialab.SMT.SMTZonePicker picker
      Matrix used to test if the zone has gone off the screen
      protected static java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<Zone> zoneList
      The main zone list

        The main zone list

        protected vialab.SMT.SMTZonePicker picker
        Matrix used to test if the zone has gone off the screen

      • defaultRenderer

        public static java.lang.String defaultRenderer
        The renderer to use as a default for zones, can be P3D, P2D, OPENGL, etc, upon TouchClient initialization this is set to the same as the PApplet's renderer

    • Constructor Detail

      • TouchClient

        public TouchClient(processing.core.PApplet parent)
        Default Constructor. Default port is 3333 for TUIO
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet - The Processing PApplet

      • TouchClient

        public TouchClient(processing.core.PApplet parent,
           int port)
        Constructor. Allows you to select the TouchSource backend from which to get multi-touch events from
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet - The Processing PApplet, usually just 'this' when using the Processing IDE
        port - int - The port to listen on

      • TouchClient

        public TouchClient(processing.core.PApplet parent,
           TouchSource source)
        Constructor. Allows you to select the TouchSource backend from which to get multi-touch events from
        Parameters:
        parent - PApplet - The Processing PApplet, usually just 'this' when using the Processing IDE
        source - enum TouchSource - The source of touch events to listen to. One of: TouchSource.MOUSE, TouchSource.TUIO_DEVICE, TouchSource.ANDROID, TouchSource.WM_TOUCH, TouchSource.SMART

    • Method Detail

      • warnUncalled

        public void warnUncalled()
        This displays the methods that have not been called by the Zones/TouchClient, useful for debugging that a method is being called

      • setWarnUnimplemented

        public void setWarnUnimplemented(boolean warn)
        Calling this function overrides the default behavior of showing select unimplemented based on defaults for each zone specified in loadMethods()
        Parameters:
        warn - whether to warn when there are unimplemented methods for zones

      • passAndroidTouchEvent

        public boolean passAndroidTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent me)
        Redirects the MotionEvent object to AndroidToTUIO, used because current version of Processing (2.x) does not support registerMethod("touchEvent", target).
        Parameters:
        me - MotionEvent - the motion event triggered in Android
        Returns:
        Should the event get consumed elsewhere or not

      • getZones

        public Zone[] getZones()
        Returns the list of zones.
        Returns:
        zoneList

      • setDrawTouchPoints

        public void setDrawTouchPoints(boolean drawTouchPoints)
        Sets the flag for drawing touch points in the PApplet. Draws the touch points if flag is set to true.
        Parameters:
        drawTouchPoints - boolean - flag

      • setDrawTouchPoints

        public void setDrawTouchPoints(boolean drawTouchPoints,
                      int max_path_length)
        Sets the flag for drawing touch points in the PApplet. Draws the touch points if flag is set to true. Sets the maximum path length to draw to be max_path_length
        Parameters:
        drawTouchPoints - boolean - flag
        max_path_length - int - sets maximum path length to draw

      • drawTouchPoints

        public static void drawTouchPoints()
        Draws the touch points in the PApplet if flag is set to true.

      • add

        public void add(Zone... zones)
        Adds a zone to the zone list. When a student creates a zone, they must add it to this list.
        Parameters:
        zones - Zone - The zones to add to the list.

      • add

        public Zone[] add(java.lang.String xmlFilename)
        This adds zones by creating them from XML specs, the XML needs "zone" tags, and currently supports the following variables: name, x, y, width, height, img
        Parameters:
        xmlFilename - The XML file to read in for zone configuration
        Returns:
        The array of zones created from the XML File

      • grid

        public void grid(int x,
        int y,
        int width,
        int xSpace,
        int ySpace,
        Zone... zones)
        This organizes the given zones into a grid configuration with the given x, y, width, height, and spacing
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        width -
        xSpace -
        ySpace -
        zones -

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Zone zone)
        This removes the zone given from the TouchClient, meaning it will not be drawn anymore or be assigned touches, but can be added back with a call to add(zone);
        Parameters:
        zone - The zone to remove
        Returns:
        Whether the zone was removed

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Performs the drawing of the zones in order. Zone on top-most layer gets drawn last. Goes through the list on zones, pushes the current transformation matrix, applies the zone's matrix, draws the zone, pops the matrix, and when at the end of the list, it draws the touch points.

      • drawPickBuffer

        public void drawPickBuffer(int x,
                  int y,
                  int w,
                  int h)
        Draws a texture of the pickBuffer at the given x,y position with given width and height
        Parameters:
        x - - the x position to draw the pickBuffer image at
        y - - the y position to draw the pickBuffer image at
        w - - the width of the pickBuffer image to draw
        h - - the height of the pickBuffer image to draw

        public java.util.Vector<TUIO.TuioObject> getTuioObjects()

        Returns:
        Vector

                 Touch... touches)
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:
        A Map indexing all touches by their session_id's

        Returns:

      • getTouch

        public static Touch getTouch(long s_id)
        Returns the Touch(TuioCursor) associated with the session ID
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        TuioCursor

      • getPathStartTouch

        public static Touch getPathStartTouch(long s_id)
        Parameters:
        s_id - The session_id of the Touch to get the path start of
        Returns:
        A new Touch containing the state of the touch at path start

      • getLastTouch

        public static Touch getLastTouch(Touch current)
        Deprecated. 
        This creates a new Touch object from the last touch of a given Touch object, the new Touch will not update.

        It is easier to just create a new Touch with the given Touch object as its parameter "new Touch(current)" where current is the Touch we want the last touch of, so this is deprecated.

        Parameters:
        current - The Touch to get the last touch from
        Returns:
        A Touch containing the last touch, will not update, stays consistent

      • getTouchCount

        public int getTouchCount()
        Returns the number of current Touches (TuioCursors)
        Returns:
        number of current touches

      • pre

        public void pre()
        Manipulates the zone's position if it is throw-able after it has been released by a finger (cursor) Done before each call to draw. Uses the zone's x and y friction values.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Disconnects the TuioClient when the PApplet is stopped. Shuts down any threads, disconnect from the net, unload memory, etc.

      • runExe

        public static void runExe(java.lang.String path)
        Runs an exe from a path, presumably for translating native events to tuio events

      • putZoneOnTop

        public void putZoneOnTop(Zone zone)
        Parameters:
        zone - The zone to place on top of the others
